<ce:figure id="f0010">
<ce:label>Fig. 1</ce:label>
<ce:caption>
<ce:simple-para id="sp0045" view="all">a) the linear Zn-trimer — Zn<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)(CO)<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> containing two octahedra and one trigonal bipyramid; b) Zn-trimer interconnecting adjacent three Zn-trimers by different pairs of FDA molecules; c) honeycomb (6,3)-net formed by linear Zn-trimer and FDA; d) the bnn-type topology reduced by linear Zn-trimer as the node and FDA and bpp as the connectors.</ce:simple-para>
</ce:caption>

elements.clean_text: Fig. 1  a) the linear Zn-trimer - Zn3(H2O)(CO)6N2 containing two octahedra and one trigonal bipyramid; b) Zn-trimer interconnecting adjacent three Zn-trimers by different pairs of FDA molecules; c) honeycomb (6,3)-net formed by linear Zn-trimer and FDA; d) the bnn-type topology reduced by linear Zn-trimer as the node and FDA and bpp as the connectors.

elements.content:
<ce:figure id="sch0005">
<ce:label>Scheme 1</ce:label>
<ce:caption>
<ce:simple-para id="sp0040" view="all">Three different coordination modes of FDA ligands in compounds <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> and <ce:bold>2</ce:bold>: i. μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>-; ii. μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>-; iii. μ<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">0</ce:sup>-.</ce:simple-para>
<ce:simple-para id="sp0055" view="all">
<ce:bold>1</ce:bold> contains two modes of μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>- (i) and μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>- (ii), and <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> contains only one mode of μ<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">0</ce:sup>- (iii).</ce:simple-para>
</ce:caption>
<ce:link locator="sc1"></ce:link>
</ce:figure>
elements.clean_text: Scheme 1  Three different coordination modes of FDA ligands in compounds 1 and 2: i. μ4-η1, η1, η1, η1-; ii. μ4-η2, η1, η1, η1-; iii. μ3-η1, η1, η1, η0-.  1 contains two modes of μ4-η1, η1, η1, η1- (i) and μ4-η2, η1, η1, η1- (ii), and 2 contains only one mode of μ3-η1, η1, η1, η0- (iii).

elements.content: <ce:section-title>Abstract</ce:section-title><ce:simple-para id="sp0005" view="all">The furan-2,5-dicarboxyl acid (FDA) is firstly utilized to the construction of MOFs, and the pillars are enlisted in the structural formation by the method of ligand-to-ligand. The pillar properties play an important role in final structure. The flexible bpp (1,3-bi(4-pyridyl)propane) results in the robust porous [Zn<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>·(FDA)<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>·bpp·H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O]·2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>) with high thermal stability (~<ce:hsp sp="0.10"></ce:hsp>270<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C) and medium CO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> uptake (1.65<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol/g, 273<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>K), and the rigid bipy (4,4′-bipyridine) in 3-/3-D interpenetrated [Zn·(FDA)·bipy]·2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>).</ce:simple-para>
elements.clean_text:
Abstract

The furan-2,5-dicarboxyl acid (FDA) is firstly utilized to the construction of MOFs, and the pillars are enlisted in the structural formation by the method of ligand-to-ligand. The pillar properties play an important role in final structure. The flexible bpp (1,3-bi(4-pyridyl)propane) results in the robust porous [Zn3⋅(FDA)3⋅bpp⋅H2O]⋅2H2O (1) with high thermal stability (~270°C) and medium CO2 uptake (1.65mmol/g, 273K), and the rigid bipy (4,4'-bipyridine) in 3-/3-D interpenetrated [Zn⋅(FDA)⋅bipy]⋅2H2O (2).

elements.content:
<ce:section-title>Graphical abstract</ce:section-title><ce:simple-para id="sp0010" view="all">The metal ion, furan-2,5-dicarboxyl acid and ligand-to-ligand pillar are assembled into MOFs. The flexible bpp results in the robust porous <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> and the rigid bipy in 3-/3-D interpenetrated <ce:bold>2</ce:bold>.<ce:display>
<ce:figure id="f0005">
<ce:link locator="fx1"></ce:link>
</ce:figure>
</ce:display>
</ce:simple-para><ce:section-title>Highlights</ce:section-title><ce:simple-para id="sp0015" view="all">► The furan-2,5-dicarboxyl acid is firstly utilized to the construction of MOFs. ► The pillars are enlisted in the structure by the method of ligand-to-ligand. ► The pillar properties play an important role in final structure. ► The bpp results in the robust porous <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> and the bipy in 3-/3-D interpenetrated <ce:bold>2</ce:bold>.</ce:simple-para>
elements.clean_text:
Graphical abstract

The metal ion, furan-2,5-dicarboxyl acid and ligand-to-ligand pillar are assembled into MOFs. The flexible bpp results in the robust porous 1 and the rigid bipy in 3-/3-D interpenetrated 2.     

Highlights

► The furan-2,5-dicarboxyl acid is firstly utilized to the construction of MOFs. ► The pillars are enlisted in the structure by the method of ligand-to-ligand. ► The pillar properties play an important role in final structure. ► The bpp results in the robust porous 1 and the bipy in 3-/3-D interpenetrated 2.

elements.content:
<ce:figure id="f0005">
<ce:link locator="fx1"></ce:link>
</ce:figure>

<ce:para id="p0005" view="all">The experimental and theoretical efforts have recently been focused on the rational design and controlled synthesis of metal–organic frameworks (MOFs) due to not only their potential applications but also their intriguing versatile architectures . One of the most effective ways is the appropriate choice of well-designed molecular building blocks (MBB) and metal ions or clusters to achieve the targeting assemblies of such extended crystalline systems with desired structural features and/or physicochemical properties . Although MBBs with 2-fold linear , 3-fold  and 4-fold  symmetries are popular choices for obtaining the well-defined MOFs, 2-fold non-linear MBB is rarely studied. This lies in two aspects: bigger steric hindrance and necessity of the auxiliary ligand known as pillar to sustain the architecture . Compared with BDC , non-linear FDA possesses two advantages as the MBB: the high openness net with the flexible bond angle of two carboxyl (~<ce:hsp sp="0.10"></ce:hsp>126°) and the polarity owing to the oxygen atom of ring, which is potentially applied for gas-storage and gas-separation. Due to the non-linear FDA as the MBB, the choice of the pillar would effect the structural formations — porosity and interpenetration. With respect to the steric hindrance and electronic effect, the flexible and rigid pillars are employed to the construction of structure, respectively. In this work, two novel MOFs have been synthesized, in which the flexible bpp results in the robust porous [Zn<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>·(FDA)<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>·bpp·H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O]·2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>), and the rigid bipy in 3-/3-D interpenetrated [Zn·(FDA)·bipy]·2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>).</ce:para>
elements.clean_text: The experimental and theoretical efforts have recently been focused on the rational design and controlled synthesis of metal-organic frameworks (MOFs) due to not only their potential applications but also their intriguing versatile architectures . One of the most effective ways is the appropriate choice of well-designed molecular building blocks (MBB) and metal ions or clusters to achieve the targeting assemblies of such extended crystalline systems with desired structural features and/or physicochemical properties . Although MBBs with 2-fold linear , 3-fold  and 4-fold  symmetries are popular choices for obtaining the well-defined MOFs, 2-fold non-linear MBB is rarely studied. This lies in two aspects: bigger steric hindrance and necessity of the auxiliary ligand known as pillar to sustain the architecture . Compared with BDC , non-linear FDA possesses two advantages as the MBB: the high openness net with the flexible bond angle of two carboxyl (~126°) and the polarity owing to the oxygen atom of ring, which is potentially applied for gas-storage and gas-separation. Due to the non-linear FDA as the MBB, the choice of the pillar would effect the structural formations - porosity and interpenetration. With respect to the steric hindrance and electronic effect, the flexible and rigid pillars are employed to the construction of structure, respectively. In this work, two novel MOFs have been synthesized, in which the flexible bpp results in the robust porous [Zn3⋅(FDA)3⋅bpp⋅H2O]⋅2H2O (1), and the rigid bipy in 3-/3-D interpenetrated [Zn⋅(FDA)⋅bipy]⋅2H2O (2).

elements.content:
<ce:para id="p0010" view="all">Colorless crystals of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>
 and <ce:bold>2</ce:bold>
 are solvothermally synthesized by mixing Zn(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O, FDA and bpp (1,3-bi(4-pyridyl)propane)/bipy (4,4′-bipyridine) in ethanol or ethanol/DMF (detailed procedures of compounds <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> and <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> are depicted in S1 of ESI).</ce:para>
elements.clean_text: Colorless crystals of 1  and 2  are solvothermally synthesized by mixing Zn(NO3)2⋅6H2O, FDA and bpp (1,3-bi(4-pyridyl)propane)/bipy (4,4'-bipyridine) in ethanol or ethanol/DMF (detailed procedures of compounds 1 and 2 are depicted in S1 of ESI).

elements.content:
<ce:para id="p0015" view="all">The asymmetric unit of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> consists of three Zn ions, one coordinated water molecule, three FDA, one bpp molecule and two structural water molecules. Three crystallographic independent Zn ions display distinct coordinated geometry. Zn1 ion is octahedrally coordinated by six carboxyl oxygens of six FDA molecules. Zn2 ion is square-pyramidly coordinated by four carboxyl oxygens of three FDA molecules and one N atom of bpp. Zn3 ion is octahedrally coordinated by four carboxyl oxygens of three FDA molecules, one water molecule and one nitrogen of bpp. Three FDA molecules are all μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-bridge and fall into two types: one μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>- FDA and two μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η1, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>- FDA (
<ce:float-anchor refid="sch0005"></ce:float-anchor>). Three zinc (II) centers are corner-sharingly arrayed by virtue of the bidentate functionalities of three symmetry-inequivalent FDA with Zn2-Zn1-Zn3 of 144.1°, Zn1-Zn2 of 3.336Ǻ and Zn1-Zn3 of 3.606Ǻ (Fig. S5a). The linear arrayed Zn-trimer is coordinated by six FDA and two bpp to give rise to the Zn<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)(CO)<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> as the node (a<ce:float-anchor refid="f0010"></ce:float-anchor>).</ce:para>
elements.clean_text: The asymmetric unit of 1 consists of three Zn ions, one coordinated water molecule, three FDA, one bpp molecule and two structural water molecules. Three crystallographic independent Zn ions display distinct coordinated geometry. Zn1 ion is octahedrally coordinated by six carboxyl oxygens of six FDA molecules. Zn2 ion is square-pyramidly coordinated by four carboxyl oxygens of three FDA molecules and one N atom of bpp. Zn3 ion is octahedrally coordinated by four carboxyl oxygens of three FDA molecules, one water molecule and one nitrogen of bpp. Three FDA molecules are all μ4-bridge and fall into two types: one μ4-η1, η1, η1, η1- FDA and two μ4-η2, η1, η1, η1- FDA ( ). Three zinc (II) centers are corner-sharingly arrayed by virtue of the bidentate functionalities of three symmetry-inequivalent FDA with Zn2-Zn1-Zn3 of 144.1°, Zn1-Zn2 of 3.336Ǻ and Zn1-Zn3 of 3.606Ǻ (Fig. S5a). The linear arrayed Zn-trimer is coordinated by six FDA and two bpp to give rise to the Zn3(H2O)(CO)6N2 as the node (a).

elements.content: <ce:para id="p0020" view="all">Every Zn-trimer interconnects three Zn-trimers through one pair of FDAs in two modes: one pair of μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>- FDAs (top in b) and one pair of μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>- FDAs (bottom in b), which gives the (6,3) net (c). It is worth noting that two furan rings of two μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>- FDAs (top in b) occupy the opposite positions with π–π conjugation, in which stacking h (center-plane) is in 3.276<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>~<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>3.290<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å, d(center-center) in 3.4645<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>~<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>3.367<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å and shift r (displacement of two centers) in 1.1272<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>~<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>0.7159<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å. However, two furan rings of μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>- FDAs (bottom in b) depart head-to-head from each other with the distance of two oxygens being 4.7954<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å. This is owing to η<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup>-O of μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>- FDAs (top in b) which shortens the distance between furan rings. The dihedral angles of three furan rings is close to 120° (dihedral angle of two furan rings of two μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>- FDAs in 111.6°, two furan rings of μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>- FDA and μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>- FDA in 117.1° and 113.3°, which promotes the formation of (6,3) net. The sheets are linked by bpp to 5-c bnn type topology with the Schläfli symbol of (4<ce:sup loc="post">6</ce:sup>·6<ce:sup loc="post">4</ce:sup>) (d). When the framework of MOF material is neutral and no balanced ion exists in the channel, water molecule or solvent often occupy the channel by the H-bond or van der waals force. In this work, water molecule remains in the channel. With the removal of the water, large accessible void is 676.2Ǻ<ce:sup loc="post">3</ce:sup> about 32.0% of the unit cell volume (2114.9Ǻ<ce:sup loc="post">3</ce:sup>).</ce:para>
elements.clean_text: Every Zn-trimer interconnects three Zn-trimers through one pair of FDAs in two modes: one pair of μ4-η2, η1, η1, η1- FDAs (top in b) and one pair of μ4-η1, η1, η1, η1- FDAs (bottom in b), which gives the (6,3) net (c). It is worth noting that two furan rings of two μ4-η2, η1, η1, η1- FDAs (top in b) occupy the opposite positions with π-π conjugation, in which stacking h (center-plane) is in 3.276~3.290Å, d(center-center) in 3.4645~3.367Å and shift r (displacement of two centers) in 1.1272~0.7159Å. However, two furan rings of μ4-η1, η1, η1, η1- FDAs (bottom in b) depart head-to-head from each other with the distance of two oxygens being 4.7954Å. This is owing to η2-O of μ4-η2, η1, η1, η1- FDAs (top in b) which shortens the distance between furan rings. The dihedral angles of three furan rings is close to 120° (dihedral angle of two furan rings of two μ4-η2, η1, η1, η1- FDAs in 111.6°, two furan rings of μ4-η2, η1, η1, η1- FDA and μ4-η1, η1, η1, η1- FDA in 117.1° and 113.3°, which promotes the formation of (6,3) net. The sheets are linked by bpp to 5-c bnn type topology with the Schläfli symbol of (46⋅64) (d). When the framework of MOF material is neutral and no balanced ion exists in the channel, water molecule or solvent often occupy the channel by the H-bond or van der waals force. In this work, water molecule remains in the channel. With the removal of the water, large accessible void is 676.2Ǻ3 about 32.0% of the unit cell volume (2114.9Ǻ3).

elements.content: <ce:para id="p0025" view="all">The asymmetric unit of <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> is composed of one Zn ion, one FDA, one bipy molecule and one structural water molecule. Every μ<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">0</ce:sup>- FDA bridges three Zn ions. Zn is coordinated by two nitrogens of two bipy molecules and three oxygens of three FDA, displaying trigonal bipyramid geometry with three oxygens positioned at the equator and two nitrogens at the apices. Two η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>- carboxyl of two FDAs link two Zn to dimer with Zn<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>Zn of 4.024Ǻ (a<ce:float-anchor refid="f0015"></ce:float-anchor>). The Zn-dimer is linked by four FDA and four bipy as the node (a).</ce:para>
elements.clean_text: The asymmetric unit of 2 is composed of one Zn ion, one FDA, one bipy molecule and one structural water molecule. Every μ3-η1, η1, η1, η0- FDA bridges three Zn ions. Zn is coordinated by two nitrogens of two bipy molecules and three oxygens of three FDA, displaying trigonal bipyramid geometry with three oxygens positioned at the equator and two nitrogens at the apices. Two η1, η1- carboxyl of two FDAs link two Zn to dimer with ZnZn of 4.024Ǻ (a). The Zn-dimer is linked by four FDA and four bipy as the node (a).

elements.content: <ce:para id="p0030" view="all">Owing to the symmetrical geometry of <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> (Pccn), two sets of structures 3-dimesionally interpenetrate each other, each one of which is reduced to pcu topology with the Zn-dimer as node and FDA/bipy as the connector (b). Although every FDA connects three Zn, FDA acts as two-connector because FDA connects two Zn-dimers. Both sets of structures consist of such a SBU served as octahedral geometry, in which four 2-c FDAs occupy the equatorial plane and two pairs of 2-c bipy molecules respectively locate on the apices (a and b). Weak π–π interactions exist between two bipy molecules of every pair with twist φ of 26.7° and stacking h of 3.379<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å. The distances of two Zn-dimers linked by bipy and FDA are 11.405<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å and 11.889<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å, respectively. The torsion angle of two furan rings in different set of structure is 25.04°.</ce:para>
elements.clean_text: Owing to the symmetrical geometry of 2 (Pccn), two sets of structures 3-dimesionally interpenetrate each other, each one of which is reduced to pcu topology with the Zn-dimer as node and FDA/bipy as the connector (b). Although every FDA connects three Zn, FDA acts as two-connector because FDA connects two Zn-dimers. Both sets of structures consist of such a SBU served as octahedral geometry, in which four 2-c FDAs occupy the equatorial plane and two pairs of 2-c bipy molecules respectively locate on the apices (a and b). Weak π-π interactions exist between two bipy molecules of every pair with twist φ of 26.7° and stacking h of 3.379Å. The distances of two Zn-dimers linked by bipy and FDA are 11.405Å and 11.889Å, respectively. The torsion angle of two furan rings in different set of structure is 25.04°.

elements.content: <ce:para id="p0035" view="all">The thermal stability is an important property for applying for catalyst or gas-storage. The thermogravimetric analysis can render the removal of the guest-molecule and the decomposition of linker and pillar. The in situ XRD discerns the framework change when the guest-molecule is removed and linker and pillar are decomposed.</ce:para>
elements.clean_text: The thermal stability is an important property for applying for catalyst or gas-storage. The thermogravimetric analysis can render the removal of the guest-molecule and the decomposition of linker and pillar. The in situ XRD discerns the framework change when the guest-molecule is removed and linker and pillar are decomposed.

elements.content: <ce:para id="p0040" view="all">The thermogravimetric analysis of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> (in N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>) shows a sharp weight loss ranging from 270<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C to 450<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C (52.3%) corresponding to decomposition of FDA and bpp (Fig. S7). This also exhibits the framework stability (only 4% weight loss from room temperature to 270<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C assigned to the structural water). The thermogravimetric analysis of <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> (in N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>) shows continuously two-step weight loss (gradual and sharp) ranging from 150<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C to 450<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C (62.8%) corresponding to decomposition of FDA and bipy, which indicates the structural unstability of compound <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> (Fig. S8).</ce:para>
elements.clean_text: The thermogravimetric analysis of 1 (in N2) shows a sharp weight loss ranging from 270°C to 450°C (52.3%) corresponding to decomposition of FDA and bpp (Fig. S7). This also exhibits the framework stability (only 4% weight loss from room temperature to 270°C assigned to the structural water). The thermogravimetric analysis of 2 (in N2) shows continuously two-step weight loss (gradual and sharp) ranging from 150°C to 450°C (62.8%) corresponding to decomposition of FDA and bipy, which indicates the structural unstability of compound 2 (Fig. S8).

elements.content: <ce:para id="p0045" view="all">The results of in situ XRD of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> confirm the stability of framework (Fig. S9). From 270<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C, the intensities of strong diffraction peaks gradually decrease with temperature increasing. At 310<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C, framework of compound <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> has completely collapsed with the strong diffraction peaks disappearing.</ce:para>
elements.clean_text: The results of in situ XRD of 1 confirm the stability of framework (Fig. S9). From 270°C, the intensities of strong diffraction peaks gradually decrease with temperature increasing. At 310°C, framework of compound 1 has completely collapsed with the strong diffraction peaks disappearing.

elements.content: <ce:para id="p0050" view="all">The gas-storage of MOF is of very interest. In this work, the experiments of gas adsorptions (degassed at 200<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C) indicate that <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> can adsorb CO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> instead of N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>, which is attributed to the strong quadrupole interaction of CO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>. The CO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> gas-sorption isotherms for compound <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> at 273<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>K indicate that the BET and Langmuir surface area are calculated to be 234.1 and 262.4<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>m<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup>/g, and the median pore diameter calculated by H-K method is 4.6<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å. Compound <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> indicates the medium CO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> uptake about 1.65<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol/g (Fig. S10).</ce:para>
elements.clean_text: The gas-storage of MOF is of very interest. In this work, the experiments of gas adsorptions (degassed at 200°C) indicate that 1 can adsorb CO2 instead of N2, which is attributed to the strong quadrupole interaction of CO2. The CO2 gas-sorption isotherms for compound 1 at 273K indicate that the BET and Langmuir surface area are calculated to be 234.1 and 262.4m2/g, and the median pore diameter calculated by H-K method is 4.6Å. Compound 1 indicates the medium CO2 uptake about 1.65mmol/g (Fig. S10).

elements.content: <ce:para id="p0055" view="all">Two new MOFs — porous robust <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> and 3-/3-D interpenetrated <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> — have been synthesized and structurally determined. The structural difference is owing to the properties of ligand-to-ligand pillars (flexible bpp for <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> and rigid bipy for <ce:bold>2</ce:bold>). As a result, <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> possesses the permanent and stable pore which is able to uptake CO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>, and <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> forms the 3-/3-D interpenetrated net.</ce:para>
elements.clean_text: Two new MOFs - porous robust 1 and 3-/3-D interpenetrated 2 - have been synthesized and structurally determined. The structural difference is owing to the properties of ligand-to-ligand pillars (flexible bpp for 1 and rigid bipy for 2). As a result, 1 possesses the permanent and stable pore which is able to uptake CO2, and 2 forms the 3-/3-D interpenetrated net.

elements.content: <ce:para id="p9010" view="all">CCDC 862641 – 862642 (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>–<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>, respectively) contain the supplementary crystallographic data for this paper. These data can be obtained free of charge from The Cambridge Crystallographic Data Centre via <ce:inter-ref xlink:href="http://www.ccdc.cam.ac.uk/data_request/cif" xlink:type="simple">www.ccdc.cam.ac.uk/data_request/cif</ce:inter-ref>.</ce:para>
elements.clean_text: CCDC 862641 - 862642 (1-2, respectively) contain the supplementary crystallographic data for this paper. These data can be obtained free of charge from The Cambridge Crystallographic Data Centre via www.ccdc.cam.ac.uk/data_request/cif.

Supplementary material

Supplementary material

Supplementary data to this article, involving in crystallographic data in CIF format, experimental procedures and structure details, additional images, powder X-ray diffraction, thermogravimetric analyses, ORTEP diagrams, and gas adsorption can be found online. Supplementary data associated with this article can be found, in the online version, at http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.inoche.2012.09.006.

elements.content: <ce:simple-para id="sp0030" view="all">Crystal data for 1: C31H24N2O18Zn3, Mw<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>908.63, triclinic, P-1, a<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>11.727(2) Ǻ, b<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>13.451(3) Ǻ, c<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>15.565(3)Ǻ, α<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>98.71(3)° β<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>102.97(3)° γ<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>2115.0(7)° V<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>2115.0(7) Ǻ3, T<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>293(2)K, Z<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>2, 5810 out of 9592, with I<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>><ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>2σ(I), R1<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>0.0746 (I<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>><ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>2σ(I)), wR2<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>0.2284 (all data).</ce:simple-para>

<ce:simple-para id="sp0035" view="all">Crystal data for <ce:bold>2</ce:bold>: C<ce:inf loc="post">32</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">24</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">11</ce:inf>Zn<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>, Mw<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>771.30, orthorhombic, Pccn, a<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>18.298(4) Ǻ, b<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>11.405(2) Ǻ, c<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>15.185(3) Ǻ, V<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>3168.9(11) Ǻ<ce:sup loc="post">3</ce:sup>, T<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>293(2) K, Z<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>8, 2340 out of 2794 with I<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>><ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>2σ(I), R<ce:inf loc="post">1</ce:inf>
<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>0.0895 (I<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>><ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>2σ(I)), wR2<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>0.2094 (all data).</ce:simple-para>

cln_elements.content:
<ce:para id="p0020" view="all">Every Zn-trimer interconnects three Zn-trimers through one pair of FDAs in two modes: one pair of μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>- FDAs (top in b) and one pair of μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>- FDAs (bottom in b), which gives the (6,3) net (c). It is worth noting that two furan rings of two μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>- FDAs (top in b) occupy the opposite positions with π–π conjugation, in which stacking h (center-plane) is in 3.276<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>~<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>3.290<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å, d(center-center) in 3.4645<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>~<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>3.367<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å and shift r (displacement of two centers) in 1.1272<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>~<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>0.7159<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å. However, two furan rings of μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>- FDAs (bottom in b) depart head-to-head from each other with the distance of two oxygens being 4.7954<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å. This is owing to η<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup>-O of μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>- FDAs (top in b) which shortens the distance between furan rings. The dihedral angles of three furan rings is close to 120° (dihedral angle of two furan rings of two μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>- FDAs in 111.6°, two furan rings of μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>- FDA and μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>- FDA in 117.1° and 113.3°, which promotes the formation of (6,3) net. The sheets are linked by bpp to 5-c bnn type topology with the Schläfli symbol of (4<ce:sup loc="post">6</ce:sup>·6<ce:sup loc="post">4</ce:sup>) (d). When the framework of MOF material is neutral and no balanced ion exists in the channel, water molecule or solvent often occupy the channel by the H-bond or van der waals force. In this work, water molecule remains in the channel. With the removal of the water, large accessible void is 676.2Ǻ<ce:sup loc="post">3</ce:sup> about 32.0% of the unit cell volume (2114.9Ǻ<ce:sup loc="post">3</ce:sup>).</ce:para><ce:para id="p0030" view="all">Owing to the symmetrical geometry of <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> (Pccn), two sets of structures 3-dimesionally interpenetrate each other, each one of which is reduced to pcu topology with the Zn-dimer as node and FDA/bipy as the connector (b). Although every FDA connects three Zn, FDA acts as two-connector because FDA connects two Zn-dimers. Both sets of structures consist of such a SBU served as octahedral geometry, in which four 2-c FDAs occupy the equatorial plane and two pairs of 2-c bipy molecules respectively locate on the apices (a and b). Weak π–π interactions exist between two bipy molecules of every pair with twist φ of 26.7° and stacking h of 3.379<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å. The distances of two Zn-dimers linked by bipy and FDA are 11.405<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å and 11.889<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å, respectively. The torsion angle of two furan rings in different set of structure is 25.04°.</ce:para><ce:para id="p0040" view="all">The thermogravimetric analysis of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> (in N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>) shows a sharp weight loss ranging from 270<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C to 450<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C (52.3%) corresponding to decomposition of FDA and bpp (Fig. S7). This also exhibits the framework stability (only 4% weight loss from room temperature to 270<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C assigned to the structural water). The thermogravimetric analysis of <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> (in N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>) shows continuously two-step weight loss (gradual and sharp) ranging from 150<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C to 450<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C (62.8%) corresponding to decomposition of FDA and bipy, which indicates the structural unstability of compound <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> (Fig. S8).</ce:para><ce:para id="p0050" view="all">The gas-storage of MOF is of very interest. In this work, the experiments of gas adsorptions (degassed at 200<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C) indicate that <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> can adsorb CO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> instead of N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>, which is attributed to the strong quadrupole interaction of CO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>. The CO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> gas-sorption isotherms for compound <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> at 273<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>K indicate that the BET and Langmuir surface area are calculated to be 234.1 and 262.4<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>m<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup>/g, and the median pore diameter calculated by H-K method is 4.6<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å. Compound <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> indicates the medium CO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> uptake about 1.65<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol/g (Fig. S10).</ce:para><ce:simple-para id="sp0030" view="all">Crystal data for 1: C31H24N2O18Zn3, Mw<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>908.63, triclinic, P-1, a<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>11.727(2) Ǻ, b<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>13.451(3) Ǻ, c<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>15.565(3)Ǻ, α<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>98.71(3)° β<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>102.97(3)° γ<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>2115.0(7)° V<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>2115.0(7) Ǻ3, T<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>293(2)K, Z<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>2, 5810 out of 9592, with I<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>><ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>2σ(I), R1<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>0.0746 (I<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>><ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>2σ(I)), wR2<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>0.2284 (all data).</ce:simple-para><ce:simple-para id="sp0035" view="all">Crystal data for <ce:bold>2</ce:bold>: C<ce:inf loc="post">32</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">24</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">11</ce:inf>Zn<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>, Mw<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>771.30, orthorhombic, Pccn, a<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>18.298(4) Ǻ, b<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>11.405(2) Ǻ, c<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>15.185(3) Ǻ, V<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>3168.9(11) Ǻ<ce:sup loc="post">3</ce:sup>, T<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>293(2) K, Z<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>8, 2340 out of 2794 with I<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>><ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>2σ(I), R<ce:inf loc="post">1</ce:inf>
<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>0.0895 (I<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>><ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>2σ(I)), wR2<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>0.2094 (all data).</ce:simple-para>
cln_elements.clean_text:
Every Zn-trimer interconnects three Zn-trimers through one pair of FDAs in two modes: one pair of μ4-η2, η1, η1, η1- FDAs (top in b) and one pair of μ4-η1, η1, η1, η1- FDAs (bottom in b), which gives the (6,3) net (c). It is worth noting that two furan rings of two μ4-η2, η1, η1, η1- FDAs (top in b) occupy the opposite positions with π-π conjugation, in which stacking h (center-plane) is in 3.276~3.290Å, d(center-center) in 3.4645~3.367Å and shift r (displacement of two centers) in 1.1272~0.7159Å. However, two furan rings of μ4-η1, η1, η1, η1- FDAs (bottom in b) depart head-to-head from each other with the distance of two oxygens being 4.7954Å. This is owing to η2-O of μ4-η2, η1, η1, η1- FDAs (top in b) which shortens the distance between furan rings. The dihedral angles of three furan rings is close to 120° (dihedral angle of two furan rings of two μ4-η2, η1, η1, η1- FDAs in 111.6°, two furan rings of μ4-η2, η1, η1, η1- FDA and μ4-η1, η1, η1, η1- FDA in 117.1° and 113.3°, which promotes the formation of (6,3) net. The sheets are linked by bpp to 5-c bnn type topology with the Schläfli symbol of (46⋅64) (d). When the framework of MOF material is neutral and no balanced ion exists in the channel, water molecule or solvent often occupy the channel by the H-bond or van der waals force. In this work, water molecule remains in the channel. With the removal of the water, large accessible void is 676.2Ǻ3 about 32.0% of the unit cell volume (2114.9Ǻ3).

Owing to the symmetrical geometry of 2 (Pccn), two sets of structures 3-dimesionally interpenetrate each other, each one of which is reduced to pcu topology with the Zn-dimer as node and FDA/bipy as the connector (b). Although every FDA connects three Zn, FDA acts as two-connector because FDA connects two Zn-dimers. Both sets of structures consist of such a SBU served as octahedral geometry, in which four 2-c FDAs occupy the equatorial plane and two pairs of 2-c bipy molecules respectively locate on the apices (a and b). Weak π-π interactions exist between two bipy molecules of every pair with twist φ of 26.7° and stacking h of 3.379Å. The distances of two Zn-dimers linked by bipy and FDA are 11.405Å and 11.889Å, respectively. The torsion angle of two furan rings in different set of structure is 25.04°.

The thermogravimetric analysis of 1 (in N2) shows a sharp weight loss ranging from 270°C to 450°C (52.3%) corresponding to decomposition of FDA and bpp (Fig. S7). This also exhibits the framework stability (only 4% weight loss from room temperature to 270°C assigned to the structural water). The thermogravimetric analysis of 2 (in N2) shows continuously two-step weight loss (gradual and sharp) ranging from 150°C to 450°C (62.8%) corresponding to decomposition of FDA and bipy, which indicates the structural unstability of compound 2 (Fig. S8).

The gas-storage of MOF is of very interest. In this work, the experiments of gas adsorptions (degassed at 200°C) indicate that 1 can adsorb CO2 instead of N2, which is attributed to the strong quadrupole interaction of CO2. The CO2 gas-sorption isotherms for compound 1 at 273K indicate that the BET and Langmuir surface area are calculated to be 234.1 and 262.4m2/g, and the median pore diameter calculated by H-K method is 4.6Å. Compound 1 indicates the medium CO2 uptake about 1.65mmol/g (Fig. S10).

Crystal data for 1: C31H24N2O18Zn3, Mw=908.63, triclinic, P-1, a=11.727(2) Ǻ, b=13.451(3) Ǻ, c=15.565(3)Ǻ, α=98.71(3)° β=102.97(3)° γ=2115.0(7)° V=2115.0(7) Ǻ3, T=293(2)K, Z=2, 5810 out of 9592, with I>2σ(I), R1=0.0746 (I>2σ(I)), wR2=0.2284 (all data).

Crystal data for 2: C32H24N4O11Zn2, Mw=771.30, orthorhombic, Pccn, a=18.298(4) Ǻ, b=11.405(2) Ǻ, c=15.185(3) Ǻ, V=3168.9(11) Ǻ3, T=293(2) K, Z=8, 2340 out of 2794 with I>2σ(I), R1 =0.0895 (I>2σ(I)), wR2=0.2094 (all data).

cln_elements.content:
<ce:figure id="f0010">
<ce:label>Fig. 1</ce:label>
<ce:caption>
<ce:simple-para id="sp0045" view="all">a) the linear Zn-trimer — Zn<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)(CO)<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> containing two octahedra and one trigonal bipyramid; b) Zn-trimer interconnecting adjacent three Zn-trimers by different pairs of FDA molecules; c) honeycomb (6,3)-net formed by linear Zn-trimer and FDA; d) the bnn-type topology reduced by linear Zn-trimer as the node and FDA and bpp as the connectors.</ce:simple-para>
</ce:caption>
<ce:link locator="gr1"></ce:link>
</ce:figure>
cln_elements.clean_text: Fig. 1  a) the linear Zn-trimer - Zn3(H2O)(CO)6N2 containing two octahedra and one trigonal bipyramid; b) Zn-trimer interconnecting adjacent three Zn-trimers by different pairs of FDA molecules; c) honeycomb (6,3)-net formed by linear Zn-trimer and FDA; d) the bnn-type topology reduced by linear Zn-trimer as the node and FDA and bpp as the connectors.

cln_elements.content:
<ce:figure id="f0015">
<ce:label>Fig. 2</ce:label>
<ce:caption>
<ce:simple-para id="sp0050" view="all">a) Zn-dimer of two trigonal pyramid ZnO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>; b) Zn-dimer of two trigonal pyramid ZnO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> displaying 6-c node in which two pairs of bipy locate at the two polar positions and four FDA molecules at equatorial position; c) dual interpenetration of (4,6)-net; d) simplified dual interpenetration of two pcu by Zn-dimer as the node and FDA and bipy as the connectors.</ce:simple-para>
</ce:caption>
<ce:link locator="gr2"></ce:link>
</ce:figure>
cln_elements.clean_text: Fig. 2  a) Zn-dimer of two trigonal pyramid ZnO3N2; b) Zn-dimer of two trigonal pyramid ZnO3N2 displaying 6-c node in which two pairs of bipy locate at the two polar positions and four FDA molecules at equatorial position; c) dual interpenetration of (4,6)-net; d) simplified dual interpenetration of two pcu by Zn-dimer as the node and FDA and bipy as the connectors.

cln_elements.content:
<ce:figure id="sch0005">
<ce:label>Scheme 1</ce:label>
<ce:caption>
<ce:simple-para id="sp0040" view="all">Three different coordination modes of FDA ligands in compounds <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> and <ce:bold>2</ce:bold>: i. μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>-; ii. μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>-; iii. μ<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">0</ce:sup>-.</ce:simple-para>
<ce:simple-para id="sp0055" view="all">
<ce:bold>1</ce:bold> contains two modes of μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>- (i) and μ<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>- (ii), and <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> contains only one mode of μ<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>-η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>, η<ce:sup loc="post">0</ce:sup>- (iii).</ce:simple-para>
</ce:caption>
<ce:link locator="sc1"></ce:link>
</ce:figure>
cln_elements.clean_text: Scheme 1  Three different coordination modes of FDA ligands in compounds 1 and 2: i. μ4-η1, η1, η1, η1-; ii. μ4-η2, η1, η1, η1-; iii. μ3-η1, η1, η1, η0-.  1 contains two modes of μ4-η1, η1, η1, η1- (i) and μ4-η2, η1, η1, η1- (ii), and 2 contains only one mode of μ3-η1, η1, η1, η0- (iii).

metadata.title: Structural diversity through tuning pillar: Porous robust [Zn3(FDA)3·bpp·H2O]·2H2O and 3-/3-D dual interpenetrating [Zn·(FDA)·bipy]·2H2O
